title: Okinawan Stir-Fry (Chanpuru)
ingredients: 8ounces thinly sliced skinless pork belly (see Thinly Sliced Meat) or uncured bacon, cut into 1-inch pieces
One 14-ounce package firm tofu, drained and cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: 1. Place the pork belly or bacon in a large skillet set over high heat and cook until a good bit of the fat has rendered, about 4 minutes.
2. Add the onion to the pan and cook for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring constantly, until softened. Toss in the mushrooms and zucchini and cook for 3 minutes.

3. Add the sprouts, tofu, soy sauce, sesame oil, and salt, toss to combine everything thoroughly—don’t worry if the tofu breaks apart—and cook until the sprouts are wilted but still crunchy, about 2 minutes.
4. Remove from the heat and fold in the katsuobushi. Serve with rice.
